lines.text: I feel a little sick.
Get that way often?
Yes, the last week or so.
Say, you expecting company?

[mumbles]
I don't know.

[cynically]
Another pregnant one! Get up!... You know who the father is?
My husband.

[sarcastically]
Well, ain't we gettin' respectable! Could he help with the expenses?
He's dead!

[with contempt]
Another bill for the state! Get dressed!
Home sweet home! Just like the big cage in the zoo - only you clean it up instead of the keeper. Bucket and brush is in the corner closet.
Mrs. Benton said I was going to work in the laundry.
I'm the boss here! Start scrubbin'!
But Mrs. Benton told me...

[she sees another inmate signaling her not to talk back]
Where do I begin, Mrs. Harper?
Now you're gettin' hip.
if you stay in here too long, you don't think of guys at all - you just get out of the habit.
Come on you tramps - line up for Christmas.

[Opening lines]
Pile out, you tramps! It's the end of the line!
I'll tell Evelyn.
Don't kid me, Harper's first name is filth.
What's she in here for? (something is whispered to her) And they call us the weaker sex.
Line up, you tramps. This ain't no upstairs delicatessen.
What I'd give for a sink full of dirty dishes.
I'm a tall weed in the grass and the grapevines bloomin'.
Sign here. I'll skip the mental test, you look normal enough.
For that forty bucks I heisted I sure got myself an education.

[referring to a newly paroled Marie Allen]
What shall I do with her file?
Keep it active. She'll be back.

I didn't know what kind of a heel Harper is. She's like a cop I was sweet on once. He had to work guys over for no reason at all, just because it made him feel important. If I'd known I wouldn't have started on you.

[to Elvira]
Quit shaking the tambourine.
That trained seal can sure ask a lot of questions. Who is this Pearl Harbor anyway? What is she, an inmate?
Kill her. Kill her. Kill her.
I got news for you, she's alright.
She's a real lady, Georgia, only she married some guy who likes spendin' other people's dough, so he got her to write a bunch of bouncers. I got news for ya. Georgia gives this place class.

She ain't the only one. I had two real mink coats and a closetful of black lace nighties and a shelf full of real French perfumes that my girls lifted right out of one of the swankiest stores in town.
Don't rub it in. All I had was a different pair of shoes for every night.
Let's you and me get acquainted honey. You may be a number to others but not to me. Sit down in this chair, it's kinda roomy.
Kindly omit the flowers.
You see kid, in this cage, you get tough or you get killed. Better wise up before it's too late.
What shall I do with her file?
[last lines]
Keep it active. She'll be back.
